content.description:
“Serbia will someday set Europe by the ears and bring about a universal war on the Continent. I cannot tell you how exasperated people are getting here at the continual worry which that little country causes to Austria under encouragement from Russia. It will be lucky if Europe succeeds in avoiding war as a result of the present crisis.”
Sir Fairfax Cartwright, British ambassador to Austria-Hungary, memo to the British Foreign Office, 1913
content.question: The instability that Cartwright attributes to Serbia’s actions is best explained by which of the following?

choices.label: Colonial independence movements that challenged European domination
Nationalist agitation that threatened multiethnic empires
Diplomatic efforts to dismantle national governments in favor of a unified Europe

content.answer: Nationalist agitation that threatened multiethnic empires

topic.text: 7.9: Causation in 19th-Century Perspectives and Political Developments

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Explain a historical concept, development, or process.
